attributes.action: change the law to ensure that the Data Protection Act 1998 is never overruled by the Human Rights Act
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Currently, government agencies (DVLA, NHS etc) CANNOT refuse to supply details of private individuals addresses and other details to a third party because to do so infringes the human rights of the applicant not to be denied access to the information.  Any government agency which does refuse to divulge the information is under threat of prosecution under the Human Rights Act.
